document_data.name: Sweeten
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|8}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Sweeten''''' was a useful [[cantrip]] that acolyte [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It summoned a sprinkling of sugar or a drizzle of [[honey]] or syrup above a target creature or object.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip created a small quantity of a sweet-tasting condiment such as sugar, honey, or syrup. It appeared just above the target and fell as a fine powder or as a slow trickle of liquid. The amount was typically enough to sweeten food or drink for about six people.The original description of this cantrip in [[Dragon magazine 59|''Dragon'' #59]] put this at a dozen people. It was changed to "half-dozen" in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. The target of this spell had to be within {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} of the caster.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster made a buzzing sound while pantomiming stirring.
